# yada
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/yada)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=yada)
[![lifecycle](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
[![Travis build status](https://travis-ci.org/eehh-stanford/yada.svg?branch=identif)](https://travis-ci.org/eehh-stanford/yada)
[![Coverage status](https://codecov.io/gh/eehh-stanford/yada/branch/identif/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/github/eehh-stanford/yada?branch=identif)

`yada`, which stands for Yet Another Demographic Analysis package, supports a variety of demographic tasks, with most applications drawn from forensic anthroplogy and archaeology.

## Installation

You can install yada with:

``` r
devtools::install_github("eehh-stanford/yada")
```

## Contributing
